rComments: Paula is super nice, but it is so damn hard to understand her because of her accent [which she claims you will get use to, but i didn't!] everything is pretty much up to her t.a's who make everything so much easier to understand so go to section! the midterms were take home, but you have to really go to class to understand the material.

Paula really cared about the students, but she had trouble teaching a large class. Entire classes were spent answering two easy questions. She responds to emails and is very helpful, but I would not take a class with more than 50 people from her. If you're in intro sp06 with her, don't base your opinion of ling at UCSC on your experience there.

Paula is very helpful. She always responds quickly to emails and puts a lot of effort into teaching, but honestly, she can't teach! The course material is fairly easy, but because she doesn't really know what she's talking about, it became a lot harder.

Paula has a pretty disorganized style of teaching. She did not create a syllabus for the class and so we would stray off on tangent topics for weeks, often for longer than was needed. I wouldn't have gotten through the course if not for the TA's. She does make sure to answer people's questions, though. She's not terrible, but avoid her if you can.
